headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; GRAND TEMPERANOE DEMONSTRATION. Addresses by Rev. Theodore L. Culyer, C. C. North, Esq, and Rev. Dr. Tyng.

docs.lead_paragraph: The semi annual Ineeting of the American Temperanee Union was held on Monday evening at the Broadway Tabernacle, WILLIAM E. DODGE, Eeq , Chairman of the Executive Committee, presiding. The North Carolina Bind, conducted by Mr. M. P. TORGSI, was present, and executed various airs with exquiile taste.

headline.main: THE LOWER CALIFORNIA REPUBLIC.; ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT. $847,381 IN SPECIE. Later from the Fillibusters. President Walker at Liberty--His attack upon Grulla Successful. REPULSE OF THE ENEMY. GALLANTRY OF WALKER'S BATTALION, SECURITY OF THE INVADERS. LATER FROM SALT LAKE. Singular Address of Brigham Young to the Saliats Massaers of Capt. Gunnison and Seven of his Party by the Pauvan Indians. BUILDING OF THE TEMPLE. TWELVE DAYS LATER FROM OREGON. LATER FROM WASHINGTON. CALIFORNIA. The Mines. Miscellaneous. Chronology of California for the Year 1853. THE LOWER CALIFORNIA REPUBLIC Latest by the Steamer Southerner. Doings of the Fillibusters at Cape St. Lucas. LATER FROM OREGON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Northern Light, H. CHURCHILL, Commander, from San Juau del Norte, arrived yesterday morning at 9 o'clock, with 313 passengers, and $850,000 on freight to C. MORGAN. To Messrs. BERFORD Co., WELLS, FARGO CO., ADAMS Co., and ?? LORD, we are indebted for early papers and memoranda.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MECHI, the celebrated Agriculturist, in his Balance Sheet, read before the Society of A?s, makes some very important statements. He attributes the improvement of his lands to irrigation. The difference between the present and former Balance Sheets, lies in the live stock accounts.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Discourse of Rev. Dr. Nott, of Union College. Discourse on the Loss of the San Francisco. Board of Supervisors THE NEW YORK SKETCH CLUB. A REPUBLICAN CONGREGATION. Outrage in the Streets. FIRES. The Case of Alderman Sturtevant. Liability of Railroad Company. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM. SUPREME COURT-CIRCUIT. SUPREME COURT--IN CHAMBERS. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. COURT CALENDAR
Opening Solree at the President's House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Among the pleasant phases of Winter life in the Metropolis are the "Receptions" at the residences of the President and his Secretaries. Men of all parties and creeds meet in social harmony; and it is here that politicians find their narrow, hitter road prejudices melting away in the glowing atmosphere of the Metropolitan drawing rooms.
docs.snippet: Among the pleasant phases of Winter life in the Metropolis are the "Receptions" at the residences of the President and his Secretaries. Men of all parties and creeds meet in social harmony; and it is here that politicians find their narrow, hitter...

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; SANTA ANNA'S DICTATORSHIP EXTOLLED. Cuban Trade Declining--Commercial and General News. &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the Crescent City we have files of Havana papers up to January 15, inclusive. They are full of servile compliment to the new Dictator of Mexico, who is extolled to the skies for his wisdom, heroism and piety.
docs.snippet: By the Crescent City we have files of Havana papers up to January 15, inclusive. They are full of servile compliment to the new Dictator of Mexico, who is extolled to the skies for his wisdom, heroism and piety.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the last steamer I was unable to give matters that were at that time of some interest here, but which have passed the period for report as news.
docs.snippet: By the last steamer I was unable to give matters that were at that time of some interest here, but which have passed the period for report as news.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Crescent City is due here this morning from New-Orleans, but has not yet arrived. The Black Warrior, always punctual, is expected this afternoon with New-York mails, and they are anxiously looked for, as we received no letters by the Crescent City.
docs.snippet: The Crescent City is due here this morning from New-Orleans, but has not yet arrived. The Black Warrior, always punctual, is expected this afternoon with New-York mails, and they are anxiously looked for, as we received no letters by the Crescent...

docs.lead_paragraph: Mortality in Brooklyn in 1853. The Health Officer of Brooklyn has presented to the Common Council of that City his Annual Report of Deaths for the year 1853. We condense the principal statements of the report.
docs.snippet: Mortality in Brooklyn in 1853. The Health Officer of Brooklyn has presented to the Common Council of that City his Annual Report of Deaths for the year 1853. We condense the principal statements of the report.

headline.main: FROM ST. THOMAS.; American Vessels at the Island--Small-Pox--Cholera, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our harbor and town have been rather enlivened for a week or so past by the appearance of the United States frigate Columbia the sloop-of war Albany, and the steamer Fulton--a part of the Home Squadron under command of Commodore JOHN T. NEWTON, whose flag ship is the Columbia.
